note: Sarandë is a short ferry ride from Corfu. Jon visited here back in 2010. The beaches were full of Italian tourists and there were horses still pulling carts. I imagine has changed a lot since then. Someday I'll take Linzy there.

snippets.text: Gjirokastër is a city in southern Albania and the seat of Gjirokastër County and Gjirokastër Municipality. It is located in a valley between the Gjerë mountains and the Drino, at 300 metres above sea level. Its old town is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The city is overlooked by Gjirokastër Fortress, where the Gjirokastër National Folk Festival is held every five years. It is the birthplace of former Albanian communist leader Enver Hoxha, and author Ismail Kadare.
snippets.title: Gjirokastër

snippets.text: Berat is the ninth most populous city of Albania and the seat of Berat County and Berat Municipality. By air, it is 71 kilometres north of Gjirokastër, 70 kilometres west of Korçë, 70 kilometres south of Tirana, and 33 kilometres east of Fier.
snippets.title: Berat
